intro: Cathartolinum floridanum, commonly known as the Florida cathartolinum, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, violet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
